H0.text: Dark coat color is the adaptation most likely favored by natural selection in a rabbit when a forested area shifts from having little annual snowfall to experiencing snowfall most of the year.

H1.text: Increased body fat is the adaptation most likely favored by natural selection for a rabbit living in a forested area that shifts from having little annual snowfall to experiencing snowfall most of the year.

H2.text: Large ears to release body heat would be the adaptation favored by natural selection for a rabbit in a forested area that shifts from little annual snowfall to an area with snowfall most of the year due to climate change.

H3.text: More powerful legs for burrowing is the adaptation that natural selection would most likely favor in a rabbit when a climate shift turns a forested area with little annual snowfall into an area with snowfall most of the year.

A6.text: Having the ability to store energy as fat for metabolism

A7.text: Building an insulated nest or burrow
